intro: Corydalis densispica, commonly known as the dense-spiked corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of East Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant produces slender, branched stems and has trifoliate leaves with three oval-shaped leaflets. Corydalis densispica thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forest understories or rocky habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and shady borders in horticulture.
